headline: Taco Bell owner Yum Brands beats Q4 same-store sales estimates
summary: Investing.com -- Yum! Brands (NYSE:YUM) on Wednesday reported fourth-quarter earnings per share (EPS) of $1.73, falling short of the $1.77 consensus estimate, while revenue rose to $2.51 billion, topping expectations of $2.45 billion.

content.title: Taco Bell owner Yum Brands beats Q4 same-store sales estimates
content.summary: Investing.com -- Yum! Brands (NYSE:YUM) on Wednesday reported fourth-quarter earnings per share (EPS) of $1.73, falling short of the $1.77 consensus estimate, while revenue rose to $2.51 billion, topping expectations of $2.45 billion.

headline: Yum! Brands (NYSE:YUM) Exceeds Q4 CY2025 Expectations
summary: Fast-food company Yum! Brands (NYSE:YUM) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 6.4% year on year to $2.51 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.73 per share was 1.5% below analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: Yum! Brands (NYSE:YUM) Exceeds Q4 CY2025 Expectations
content.summary: Fast-food company Yum! Brands (NYSE:YUM) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 6.4% year on year to $2.51 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.73 per share was 1.5% below analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Yum: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The Louisville, Kentucky-based company said it had net income of $1.91 per share. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring gains, were $1.73 per share. The results missed Wall Street expectations.

content.title: Yum: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
content.summary: The Louisville, Kentucky-based company said it had net income of $1.91 per share. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring gains, were $1.73 per share. The results missed Wall Street expectations.

headline: Yum! Brands Reports Fourth-Quarter Results and Increases Dividend
summary: LOUISVILLE, Ky., February 04, 2026--Yum! Brands, Inc. (NYSE: YUM) today reported results for the fourth quarter and year ended December 31, 2025. Fourth-quarter GAAP operating profit grew 12%, and fourth-quarter Core Operating Profit excluding the lap of the 53rd week grew 11%. Fourth-quarter GAAP EPS was $1.91, and EPS excluding Special Items was $1.73. Full-year GAAP operating profit grew 7%, and full-year Core Operating Profit excluding the lap of the 53rd week grew 7%. Full-year GAAP EPS was

content.title: Yum! Brands Reports Fourth-Quarter Results and Increases Dividend
content.summary: LOUISVILLE, Ky., February 04, 2026--Yum! Brands, Inc. (NYSE: YUM) today reported results for the fourth quarter and year ended December 31, 2025. Fourth-quarter GAAP operating profit grew 12%, and fourth-quarter Core Operating Profit excluding the lap of the 53rd week grew 11%. Fourth-quarter GAAP EPS was $1.91, and EPS excluding Special Items was $1.73. Full-year GAAP operating profit grew 7%, and full-year Core Operating Profit excluding the lap of the 53rd week grew 7%. headline: Yum Brands (YUM) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Please note that during today's call, system sales and operating profit growth will exclude the impact of foreign currency.  Looking back at 2025, Taco Bell again gained market share, outperforming the QSR industry with exceptional 7% same-store sales growth and KFC delivered record-breaking unit development while hitting an incredible milestone in opening its 30,000th international restaurant.

content.title: Yum Brands (YUM) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
content.summary: Please note that during today's call, system sales and operating profit growth will exclude the impact of foreign currency.  Looking back at 2025, Taco Bell again gained market share, outperforming the QSR industry with exceptional 7% same-store sales growth and KFC delivered record-breaking unit development while hitting an incredible milestone in opening its 30,000th international restaurant.

headline: Michael Burry issues bitcoin warning, AMD stock falls hard
summary: Yahoo Finance Senior Producer John Hyland tracks Wednesday's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute. The Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) announced it will release jobs data on Wednesday, Feb. 11, and the Consumer Price Index (CPI) on Friday, Feb. 13. AMD (AMD) stock is seeing its biggest decline since 2018. Yum! Brands (YUM) missed quarterly earnings estimates, but posted revenue that was better than expected. Investor Michael Burry issued a warning about "lasting damage" from bitcoin's (BTC-USD) decline. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

content.title: Michael Burry issues bitcoin warning, AMD stock falls hard
content.description:
Yahoo Finance Senior Producer John Hyland tracks Wednesday's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute.

The Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) announced it will release jobs data on Wednesday, Feb. 11, and the Consumer Price Index (CPI) on Friday, Feb. 13.

AMD (AMD) stock is seeing its biggest decline since 2018.

Yum! Brands (YUM) missed quarterly earnings estimates, but posted revenue that was better than expected.

Investor Michael Burry issued a warning about "lasting damage" from bitcoin's (BTC-USD) decline.

Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.
content.summary: Yahoo Finance Senior Producer John Hyland tracks Wednesday's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute. The Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) announced it will release jobs data on Wednesday, Feb. 11, and the Consumer Price Index (CPI) on Friday, Feb. 13. AMD (AMD) stock is seeing its biggest decline since 2018. Yum! Brands (YUM) missed quarterly earnings estimates, but posted revenue that was better than expected. Investor Michael Burry issued a warning about "lasting damage" from bitcoin's (BTC-USD) decline. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Apple stock gains amid tech sell-off, Yum! Brands' mixed Q4 results
summary: Yahoo Finance Markets and Data Editor Jared Blikre and Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma track several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including Apple stock (AAPL) seeing gains despite a broader sell-off appearing in tech and software companies, Silicon Laboratories (SLAB) shares surging nearly 50% on news of its acquisition by Texas Instruments (TXN), and fast-food chain operator Yum! Brands (YUM) reporting mixed fourth quarter earnings results. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.
